title: Advances in Small-Footprint Keyword Spotting: A Comprehensive Review of Efficient Models and Algorithms
author: Soumen Garai (National Institute of Technology, Durgapur), Suman Samui (National Institute of Technology, Durgapur), ..., Soumen Garai
relevance_why: The paper provides insights into Tiny Machine Learning frameworks that can optimize speech processing models for edge devices, directly applicable to audio and speech applications.
background: Small-Footprint Keyword Spotting (SF-KWS) focuses on identifying specific keywords from continuous speech signals in resource-constrained devices.
contribution: This paper introduces a comprehensive overview of SF-KWS techniques, categorizing them into seven distinct groups and discussing their applicability in TinyML frameworks, achieving reduced computational complexity and enhanced efficiency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied heavily on traditional KWS models that often did not optimize for edge device constraints.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work emphasizes modern deep learning techniques and TinyML frameworks for efficient KWS deployment, balancing model complexity with resource limitations.

key_innovation: The review categorizes SF-KWS methodologies and emphasizes the integration of TinyML frameworks, facilitating deployment on low-power devices.
real_world_impact: This research lays the groundwork for improving on-device keyword recognition in consumer electronics, enhancing user experience while addressing privacy and energy concerns.
limitations: The review does not provide new experimental results or breakthroughs but serves as a foundational overview.

new_terms.Tiny Machine Learning: **Tiny Machine Learning (TinyML)** refers to deploying machine learning models on low-power devices with limited computational resources, focusing on optimizing model size and efficiency.
new_terms.Multi-objective optimization: **Multi-objective optimization (MOO)** involves solving problems with multiple conflicting objectives, balancing trade-offs such as accuracy and resource usage in model deployment.
